value.title: Use visuals in Power BI
value.excerpt: Create and customize visuals to present data in compelling and insightful ways.

value.title: A cleaner way to import files from a  SharePoint folder with a Power Query function
value.excerpt: Import files from SharePoint folder with Power Query into Power BI In today's video, I am going to show you how to import files that are stored in a SharePoint folder or library in Power BI using Power Query.   To do that we will create a function that cleans a typical file and then reuse that function

value.title: DAX Fridays! #27: RELATED vs RELATEDTABLE
value.excerpt: In today's video, we will go through two functions in DAX, related and relatedtable.  We will explain how they both work and when to use one or the other. value.title: Managing changing column names in Power Query #10: (M)agic (M)ondays
value.excerpt: In today's video, I will show how to manage column headers that changes names so your power bi file does not break when you refresh it.  This tip is from Lars Schreiber and here is the link to his blog post and how to do this in power query: http://power-bi-usergroup.blogspot.se/2015/12/dealing-with-tables-with-changing.html

value.title: Dynamic labels in Power BI using DAX
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick uses a little DAX, and the SelectedValue function, to get you some dynamic labels in your Power BI reports.  For more information about SelectedValue, check out Marco Russo's blog on the function - https://www.sqlbi.com/articles/using-the-selectedvalue-function-in-dax/  LET'S CONNECT!

value.title: How to Set Up Power BI Gateway to Connect to On-Premise Data in Enterprise Mode
value.excerpt: Power BI Gateway acts as a bridge to let PowerBI.com (Cloud) connect to your On-Premise (Local) Data Sources – like local Excel Files or a local SQL Server. value.title: Computing a measure in DAX Studio
value.excerpt: You can use DAX Studio to evaluate one or more measures in your data model. This is the first step to write, test, and debug your DAX measures in a productive manner.  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/
